title: It seems sorry wasn't the hardest word for Thomas Cook boss
text:
Sorry seems to be the hardest word, Elton John once sang; but not for Peter Fankhauser, Thomas Cook’s final chief executive, who lined up alongside four other directors be quizzed in Westminster on a murky Tuesday.

With staff sat directly behind him, decked out in their old Thomas Cook uniforms, the Swiss chief easily won the who-can-be-most-contrite award of the five.

He was “deeply sorry” the company had failed; “deeply sorry that we couldn’t save this iconic brand”; not to mention “awfully sorry that I couldn’t get the deal over the line”.
